text:
- So Will, thank you so much
for joining us here at AWS.
- Thank you for having me.

- I know you, but I'd
love for you to introduce

what you do at SK Telecom,
what your passion is.

- Sure, so it's been
about two decades already

for me to work for SK Telecom
and security companies.
And my role at this point
is to lead the strategic partnership
with peer telecom companies
but at the same time, companies like AWS.
So building cohesive partnership

to grow value not only
for both sides of us
but at the same time, external partners.
- So how did this cooperation

between AWS and SK Telecom
work, in your opinion?
How did we cooperate?
What went well?

What could we have done
better in supporting you?
I'd love some insight from you.
- It's been really exciting journey for us
to work with AWS for the past few years.

And I think there are
three companies involved

in this project, and each
party brings unique value
to this partnership.

For SK Key, we have
expertise in, Vision AI algorithm

and all those behind
the scene technologies

and SK shieldus number two
security company in Korea.
They bring, they have expertise

in security businesses,
and at the same time,
they bring a lot of vision data
and this is where AWS comes in.

So AWS's expertise in cloud
business and technology
can be a really unique asset
to make this partnership unique.
And we can unlock a lot of opportunities
that actually exist in this industry
by solving users problems together.
- We're really pleased to work with you

and SK Telecom in
co-developing this new platform
that we hope drastically simplifies

the whole computer vision
industry and how you deploy it.
But to start off with,

could you give us a little
background about SKT's vision
in the AI space?

- What we want to
achieve together with AWS
and other allies is to support industry,
transform into AI company
and harness is the true power of AI
and we want to unlock opportunities
across different industry domains.
- So what you're basically saying
is it's moving from a digital,
technology-enabled transformation
to an AI enabled transformation?

- Yes.
- Right?
- Yes, exactly.
- Okay and so why computer vision?
I mean, why was this the right first step?
Is this a geographical need?

Was it a customer need
globally that you saw?
What drove this particular use case?
- Sure, for your information, SK has
security in a subsidiary company
which is called SK shieldus.

So SK shieldus is specializing
in physical security

but we just combined
cybersecurity arm together
and we want to solve bigger problem
that industry faces today.
And for the past decade,
what we have done is SKT's AIX,
the AI and technology unit
worked really closely with SK shieldus.
So one of the key findings
was there are so many companies

and organizations wanted
to solve security issues
leveraging visual data

and SK Shieldus has an
extensive user base.

So with the close relationship
between our two companies
we have an access to those data

and then using the data,
trained our algorithm
to upgrade it to the next level.

So having said that, we
saw a lot of testimonials

from different clients saying
they relied on human labor

to monitor existing videos and
then find the right footages.

But by leveraging our
analytics and algorithm,

they could actually replace
some of the human labor
but at the same time, focusing more

on the fundamental side
of their business issues.
- Yeah, we call that at AWS,

"Removing the undifferentiated
heavy lifting."

So thank you for
cooperating with us on that.

I mean, what would you say is
the first set of use cases,

like what kind of facilities
does this get deployed in?
What kind of monitoring?
Love to understand a bit more about that.

- Sure, so if you look into
video footages accumulated,
right, that comes through those in CCTV,
typically, one of the key use case

we providing to our client
is anomaly detection.

So late at night,
suddenly you have intruder
at your facility and alarm goes on
and you dispatch your patrol to the site
but you found out that it was a dog
or it was a spider, right?
Moving on the glasses.
So it actually cost a lot of money.

At the same time, it was also
burden for SK Shieldus too,

because of those false alarm
cost a lot of resources.

So using our AI capacity,
we could actually pinpoint
whether this is a right alarm or not.

So it is kind of mutually
beneficial for both side of us.
- Oh, that's cool. (laughs)
It's really cool.

I didn't think about the spider
on the camera, personally.
But yeah, I can absolutely see that.
But why partner with AWS?
I mean, what made you pick us?

We just want to improve,
so we just want to know
what we did well, what we could do better?

- I think it all started
from the users' pain point.
So typically, a lot of domestic companies
are using very light and simple camera
but the problem with the camera
is it cannot discern or it doesn't,
since it doesn't have AI capacity,
it just record footages, right?
And lack of AI capacity

actually create a lot
of different problems.

For example, you cannot
detect anomalies in real time

at the same time, even
though after the event

you wanted to search those
in a specific events.
But it takes a lot of human labor

to view the whole footage and
find out that event, right?
We can cut through the clutters
and pinpoint the right footages

but at the same time, detecting
anomalies in real time,

that's the kind of value
we can bring together.

But previous traditional camera
doesn't have the capacity.
So what we have done together with AWS

is offloading those
burden for those camera
to record all those footages, right?

So we can actually unbundle
those heavy duty responsibility

to record those data and
analyzing data on the cloud.
So edge and cloud can goes really nicely
to share the burden, right?

- So is this South Korea's
specific implementation

or do you see this applicable
regardless of region?
Or could you talk me through that?
- Yeah, if you drop by SK Telecom booths,
there are so many telecom companies

that would show the interest
to leverage this technology.
So we have a dedicated section for AI

and one of the key corner,
the booths, using Vision AI,
and many companies express difficulties
handling these security issues.
So they wanted to work with us

and there a lot of discussion
going on at this point.
- Oh, it's great to hear.
I'm sure all of my other customers

who are in the Telco domain
would love to partner on this.
So what are the next steps?

I mean, if, let's say one
of my Telco customers at AWS

expressed an interest in
this, how do we go about it?
Do we just introduce you to them?
What's the next steps?

- I think the first step
is understanding customers,

AWS and Amazon known
for customer obsession.
Without understanding the pain point
and reality customer is facing,
we can provide overshoot product to them.

So understanding what's the
use case they wanted to address

and what are the context
around that use case.
I think having clear understanding
and then we can design solutions

tailored to meet our
customer's pain points.

- Okay, that's, thank you
for the clear guidance

and again, thank you so much
for doing this with AWS.

We can't wait to see it
like really expand globally

and start providing real value
to our mutual customer base.
- Sure, right.

We're such, it has been
great journey for us
to work with AWS.
We are like-minded partners
and focusing on the same customer problems

and we can unlock a lot
of opportunities together.

- Thank you, I'll be sure
to talk about this solution

and this platform to the
rest of my customer base.

I'm actually excited about
talking about this, so.
- Looking forward to it.
- So thanks again.
- Thank you, thanks for having me.
- Thanks for your partnership.
